reviews.text: It may sound like science fiction but it is not. Just go and extend your view high above the lovely plains and mountains in front of you. Sit on the Castle Court and sip a a fine champagne while your eyes do the walking and the wandering. This unique four star hotel offers what few hotels do: a tripn in time, back to the feudal middle ages, while enjoying a spacious neatly designed suite or room and the finest dining fit for King Arthur at Camelot. I will nver forget this treasurable experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 days as part of a walking holiday. The room was very nice, the views stunning, the pool area nice and the hotel itself beautifully decorated. The town of La Bisbal is only a short drive away and well worth visiting as are the numerous villages scattered around (Monells, Corca, Peratallada, Pals to name just a few). The negatives were mainly due to the service. There were 2 weddings whilst we were staying, as the outdoor part of the restaurant had just been renovated so I think this was a new experience for the staff, and they found it difficult to cope with those and the other hotel guests. We had lunch without making a reservation (why would you when you're lounging by the pool) and we actually thought the waiter was going to refuse us initially! In general, they looked a bit flustered and things became a little slow, but maybe with more experience they'll cope better. to precis great hotel in a stunning location, with service that's needs a little bit of attention, especially considering the price
reviews.title: stunning views, great hotel, service a bit erratic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Castel D'Emporda for fou nights in April. The town of Emporda itself is unexciting, but the Castel is beautifully restored. You must pay up and stay in a Garden Suite as the rooms (and bathrooms) are huge with beauiful views over the countryside. The Castel has a lovely relaxed feel with plenty of places to sit and chill out and is good value for what you get.
reviews.title: Beautiful restored castle - compulsory to stay in a garden suite

reviews.text: The lack of staff out of season as mentioned below was noticeable. No-one came down to the pool area to check if people wanted drinks and it was quite often hard to actually find staff at all. Naiive from the hotel's point of view given people lying by the pool in the sun are more than happy to have their money taken off them to buy drinks...
reviews.title: Idyllic location but service ,with so few guests in May ,was sadly lacking

reviews.text: We'd happily stay again - especially as the villages nearby were interesting and worth spending time in - Begur especially
reviews.title: A magnificent and beautiful hotel in a glorious setting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst garden room with magnificent setting and original artefacts tastefuly placed throughout the property were a delight , it was always a problem getting service e.g. a drink in the pool area . Again , we wandered into the dining room - no one in evidence - and sat and waited.... This level of service is not synonmous with a hotel of this standing . The staff at reception were , however, extremely helpful at all times and also spoke fluent English. Foodwise, it was not the imaginative cuisine I had anticipated with grilled lettuce hearts rather a light vegetable accompaniment ! As dinner was a special treat from my daughter , I can only say we were disappointed . B and B but no dinner is best option, in my opinion.

description: Situated in the beautiful rural Empordà region, this boutique hotel is set in a restored 14th-century castle. It offers an outdoor pool, free Wi-Fi, free parking and air-conditioned rooms with panoramic countryside views.Hotel Castell d’Empordà is within 10 km of the charming villages of Pals and Palafrugell, while the beaches of the Costa Brava beaches are just 15 km away. Girona Airport is 40-minute drive from the hotel.Rooms at the Castell d’Emporda are individually decorated, with silks from India, and furniture brought from Italia, Morocco and China. There is a CD and DVD player in each room.The hotel's Drac restaurant serves Mediterranean dishes made with fresh local produce. You can enjoy meals and drinks on the covered terrace, with wonderful countryside views.Hiking is popular in the area, and the hotel offers bicycle and car hire. There is also a 24-hour front desk, allowing you to come and go as you please.
